content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</origin>         <pubdate>20141209</pubdate>         <pubtime>Unknown</pubtime>         <title>Terrestrial Environmental Observation Network (TEON) Stations, 2014.</title>         <edition>Edition 2.0, 2014</edition>         <geoform>Vector Digital Data Set (Point)</geoform>         <pubinfo>           <pubplace>Fairbanks, Alaska</pubplace>           <publish>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</publish>         </pubinfo>         <onlink>http://arcticlcc.org/projects/teon/teon-spatial-data/show/teon-focal-watersheds-and-observation-sites-gis-data</onlink>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>The Terrestrial Environmental Observation Network (TEON) is an effort to establish a sustainable environmental observing network of northern Alaska.  TEON will focus work in watersheds that collectively represent the diversity of landscape settings at the ecoregional scale, take advantage of existing science infrastructure and logistics capacity, and provide opportunities to build on existing long-term data sets. Candidate watersheds for TEON include Agashashok River, Barrow/Meade River, Fish/Judy Creek, Hulahula River, Kokolik River, Kuparuk River, and Upper Koyukuk River.</abstract>       <purpose>These data were used to define the watershed boundaries of the TEON network and represent the general location of TEON data collection platforms.</purpose>       <supplinf>More information about TEON can be found at: http://arcticlcc.org/projects/teon/.</supplinf>     </descript>     <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <sngdate>           <caldate>20141209</caldate>         </sngdate>       </timeinfo> in any data set used to develop graphical representations, are limitations of accuracy as determined by, among others, the source, scale and resolution of the data. While Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative staff  makes every effort to represent the data as completely and accurately as possible (given existing time and resource constraints), the Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. In addition, the Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained in. Graphical representations provided by the use of this data do not represent a legal description of any kind.</useconst>     <ptcontac>       <cntinfo>         <cntorgp>           <cntorg>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</cntorg>           <cntper>Arctic LCC staff</cntper>         </cntorgp>         <cntpos>Geospatial Specialist</cntpos>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>mailing address</addrtype>           <address>101 12th Ave, Room 216</address>           <city>Fairbanks</city>           <state>Alaska</state>           <postal>99701</postal>         </cntaddr>         <cntvoice>907 456 0327</cntvoice>         <cntemail>data@arcticlcc.org</cntemail>         <hours>7:30 am to 4:30 pm.</hours>         <cntinst>Contact by email.</cntinst>       </cntinfo>     </ptcontac>     <datacred>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</datacred>     <secinfo>       <secsys>FIPS Pub 199</secsys>       <secclass>No Confidentiality</secclass>       <sechandl>Standard Technical Controls</sechandl>     </secinfo>     <native>Environment as of Metadata Creation: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 10.2 (Build 3497) Service Pack [N/A] (Build [N/A])</native>   </idinfo>   <dataqual>     <attracc>       <attraccr>No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.</attraccr>     </attracc>     <logic>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative (Arctic LCC) staff and contractors have compiled this dataset to the best of their abilities using the resources available to them.  Although the data have been gathered by sources believed to be reliable, Arctic LCC neither verifies nor guarantees the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data.</logic>     <complete>This dataset represents the location of potential TEON stations.</complete>     <posacc>       <horizpa>         <horizpar>A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.</horizpar>       </horizpa>       <vertacc>         <vertaccr>A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.</vertaccr>       </vertacc>     </posacc>     <lineage>       <srcinfo>         <srccite>           <citeinfo>             <origin>U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), EROS Data Center</origin>             <pubdate>1999</pubdate>             <title>National Elevation Dataset</title>             <geoform>Digital and/or Hardcopy Resources</geoform>             <pubinfo>               <pubplace>Sioux Falls, SD</pubplace>               <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>             </pubinfo>           </citeinfo>         </srccite>         <typesrc>Digital and/or Hardcopy Resources</typesrc>         <srctime>           <timeinfo>             <sngdate>               <caldate>1999</caldate>             </sngdate>           </timeinfo>           <srccurr>publication date</srccurr>         </srctime>         <srccitea>NED 30M</srccitea>         <srccontr>Source information used in support of the development of the data set.</srccontr>       </srcinfo>       <srcinfo>         <srccite>           <citeinfo>             <origin>B.M. Jones and G. Grosse, University of Alaska Fairbanks, Geophysical Institute Permafrost Laboratory.</origin>             <pubdate>2013</pubdate>             <title>Western Arctic Coastal Plain, IFSAR-derived, Digital Surface Model.  University of Alaska Fairbanks, Geophysical Institute Permafrost Laboratory (2013).</title>             <geoform>Digital and/or Hardcopy Resources</geoform>             <pubinfo>               <pubplace>Fairbanks, Alaska</pubplace>               <publish>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</publish>             </pubinfo>           </citeinfo>         </srccite>         <typesrc>Digital and/or Hardcopy Resources</typesrc>         <srctime>           <timeinfo>             <sngdate>               <caldate>2002</caldate>             </sngdate>           </timeinfo>           <srccurr>ground condition</srccurr>         </srctime>         <srccitea>IfSAR DEM 5 m</srccitea>         <srccontr>Source information used in support of the development of the data set.</srccontr>       </srcinfo>       <procstep>         <procdesc>The points representing the locations of the stations had to be moved to coincide with the stream channels (i.e., areas of high flow accumulation) identified by the DEM.Boundaries for the watersheds, with the exception of Nunavak Creek, are derived from the National Elevation Dataset (NED) - 1 arc-second (approximately 30 meters).  Nunavak Creek watershed boundary was derived from Western Arctic Coastal Plane (WACP) IfSAR-derived DSM (5 m). Step 1: Use the Fill (Spatial Analyst) tool in ArcGIS 10.2 to remove cells identified as sinks.  Note that peaks were not removed. Step 2: Use the Flow Direction (Spatial Analyst) tool in  ArcGIS 10.2 to determine the direct of flow from the cells in the raster. Step 3: Use the Flow Accumulation (Spatial Analyst) tool in ArcGIS 10.2 to identify areas of high flow accumulation in order to identify stream channels.</procdesc>         <procdate>2014</procdate>       </procstep>     </lineage>   </dataqual>   <spdoinfo>     <direct>Point</direct>     <ptvctinf>       <sdtsterm>         <sdtstype>Entity point</sdtstype>         <ptvctcnt>39</ptvctcnt>
